contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2012}} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} '''Werner Bruschke''' (18 August 1898, [[Magdeburg]], [[Province of Saxony]] – 17 February 1995, [[Halle (Saale)]]) was an [[East Germany|East German]] politician and member of the [[Socialist Unity Party of Germany]]. He was [[Minister-President]] of [[Saxony-Anhalt]] ([[East Germany|GDR]]) from 13 August 1949 until the state was abolished on 23 July 1952. From 1933 he worked as tobacco goods dealer and later an insurance agent. Due to his illegal political activity, he was accused in 1939 of treason (''Landesverrat'' and ''Hochverrat'') and from 1942 to 1945 was a political prisoner in the [[concentration camp]]s [[Sachsenhausen concentration camp|Sachsenhausen]] and [[Dachau concentration camp|Dachau]]. From 11 May 1992 to his death in 1995, he was the [[List of German Ministers-Presidents by longevity|oldest former Minister-President of a German state]], preceded in this by [[Bruno Diekmann]]. {{SaxonyAnhaltPMs}} {{Authority control|VIAF=37575795}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Bruschke, Werner | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = German politician | DATE OF BIRTH = 18 August 1898 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 17 February 1995 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bruschke, Werner}} [[Category:1898 births]] [[Category:1995 deaths]] [[Category:People from Magdeburg]] [[Category:People from the Province of Saxony]] [[Category:Social Democratic Party of Germany politicians]] [[Category:Socialist Unity Party of Germany politicians]] [[Category:Members of the People's Chamber of the German Democratic Republic]] [[Category:Dachau concentration camp survivors]] [[Category:German Resistance members]] [[Category:Recipients of the Patriotic Order of Merit]] [[Category:Recipients of the Banner of Labor]] {{Germany-politician-stub}}
